title: A Painting for people
brief_description: Harold Freedman was employed by the Victorian Government to paint a large mural for the Spencer Street Railway Station on the one hundred years of transport, 1835-1935. Depicts the research, hundreds of drawings and the scope of work required to complete the first part of the mural. Narrated by Harold Freedman. Suitable for secondary school level.
